VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Build Product Index Records Faster

Simplify the burden of maintaining your storefront by refreshing your storefront's product data more quickly. Now, you can split the Apex batch jobs that generate product index records into separate parallel threads. You can execute up to five batch jobs in parallel, which ensures that you can generate new product index records faster and more efficiently.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

Why: By default, the product index build executes batch jobs consecutively in a single thread. Each job class runs one after the other until the thread is complete. For orgs with large amounts of products and price list items, building product index records using this single-thread approach can take a substantial amount of time.

With this change, you can split the batch jobs into parallel threads, up to five at a time. This change allows admins to take advantage of existing Salesforce functionality in support of B2B Commerce for Visualforce storefronts, and provides finer control over specific resources.

How: After you upgrade the managed package, the Refresh Product Index section of the Indexing page in CC Admin Global Settings contains a new option. Select the number of parallel Apex batch jobs—one to five—that you want to use for refreshing the product index records.

To support this enhancement, the ccrz.ccProductIndexBuilder utility class in the B2B Commerce for Visualforce API includes a new method, getBatchScopeValues().
